intro: Lathyrus altaicus var. humilis, commonly known as the low larkspur, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnate, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it thrives in well-drained, alkaline soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
